newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Brash says not surprised by sharp fall in NZ$ TWI.
newsitem.headline: Brash says not surprised by sharp fall in NZ$ TWI.

text.p: Reserve Bank of New Zealand Governor Don Brash said on Thursday he was not surprised by the sharp fall in the New Zealand dollar's trade-weighted index after the release of the bank's economic projections.
The TWI stood at 69.04 shortly before the 2000 GMT release and by 2020 GMT had fallen to 68.66.
"I am not surprised by that reaction," Brash told reporters.
The bank said earlier that monetary conditions were inappropriately firm. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 473-4746
